meanings.definition: Arranged in a cyme or cymes.
meanings.sent1: The flowers on the plant were cymous, growing in clusters.
meanings.sent2: The cymous arrangement of the petals made the bouquet look beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The garden looked like a cymous paradise with all the flowers grouped together.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, styled in a cymous manner, cascaded down her back elegantly.
meanings.sent5: The cymous pattern of the leaves created a mesmerizing effect in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The tree displayed cymous branches filled with blossoms.
meanings.sent2: The cymous nature of the plant made it easy to propagate.
meanings.sent3: The cymous tree seemed to be showing off its floral clusters.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a cymous wonderland with all the blooming branches.
meanings.sent5: The cymous appearance of the shrub attracted many bees and butterflies.

meanings.sent1: The unique flower had a cymous shape that caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The cymous design of the arrangement gave it a modern look.
meanings.sent3: The cake was decorated in a cymous style, looking almost too pretty to eat.
meanings.sent4: The building's architecture had a cymous quality that set it apart from the rest.
meanings.sent5: The artwork featured a cymous motif that added depth to the painting.
